thread.section_title: About.com Classic Literature: Most Popular Articles
thread.title: 101 Classics to Get You Started

title: 101 Classics to Get You Started
text:
101 Classics to Get You Started A Reading List for Literary Explorers By Liam Quin (Quin, Liam: “Pictures of old books” (2003)) [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons By Adam Burgess Updated April 10, 2016 . 
Anyone, novice or expert, who is interested in reading classic literature might feel overwhelmed by the number of works categorized as "Classics." So, where should you get started? 
The list below contains 101 works spanning multiple countries and more than 2,000 years. It is meant to be a "get started" or "find something new" list for anyone on their own personal classic reading quest. 
This list is far from comprehensive. In retrospect, for example, we would certainly add John Steinbeck's The Grapes of Wrath (1939) , among others. But this is a wonderful resource to get you started! The Count of Monte Cristo (1845)
